        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • samples

        private java.util.LinkedList<byte[]> samples
        This is where we store our samples. Channels must be stored in sequence! First, store all sample from channel 1, then all samples from channel 2, etc. Ex.: s1c1 s2c1 s3c1 ... sNc1 s1c2 s2c2 s3c2 ... sNc2

      • sampler

        private ExtractSamples sampler
        This will help us to encode double values in byte arrays.

      • i_chunkSize

        private int i_chunkSize
        Store relevant data to build WAVE header. i_ stands for INTEGER (4 bytes) and s_ for SHORT (2 bytes).

      • i_subchunk1Size

        private int i_subchunk1Size
        Store relevant data to build WAVE header. i_ stands for INTEGER (4 bytes) and s_ for SHORT (2 bytes).

      • i_sampleRate

        private int i_sampleRate
        Store relevant data to build WAVE header. i_ stands for INTEGER (4 bytes) and s_ for SHORT (2 bytes).

      • i_byteRate

        private int i_byteRate
        Store relevant data to build WAVE header. i_ stands for INTEGER (4 bytes) and s_ for SHORT (2 bytes).

      • i_subchunk2Size

        private int i_subchunk2Size
        Store relevant data to build WAVE header. i_ stands for INTEGER (4 bytes) and s_ for SHORT (2 bytes).

    • Constructor Detail

      • WAVEWriter

        public WAVEWriter(int sampleRate,
          SampleSize sizeInBytes,
          int numChannels)
        Constructor that takes main info to build the header of the WAVE file. Must check after whether this exception class is good for handling the problems with sample size.
        Parameters:
        sampleRate - Sample rate of this audio file
        sizeInBytes - The size in bytes for each sample
        numChannels - Number of channels in this audio file

    • Method Detail

      • addSample

        private void addSample(byte[] sample)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Manage sample storage.
        Parameters:
        sample - A sample which will be add to the file
        Throws:
        Throw - an exception if sample size is wrong (that is, is different from what we defined in bitsPerSample).
        java.lang.Exception

        public void addSample(double sample)

      • calculateSubchunk2Size

        private int calculateSubchunk2Size()
        Calculates the size of chunks which are dependent of the number of samples.
        Returns:
        The chunk size in bytes

      • calculateChunksize

        private int calculateChunksize()

      • writeWAVEHeader

        private void writeWAVEHeader(java.lang.String filepath)
                      throws java.lang.Exception
        Functions to write the WAVE file itself. writeWAVE is the main function and the other two are auxiliary.
        Parameters:
        filepath - Output file
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - Thrown if filepath is invalid

      • bigToLittleEndian

        private byte[] bigToLittleEndian(byte[] n)
        Gets parameter N and converts to an array of bytes in LITTLE ENDIAN order.
        Parameters:
        n - An integer, a short or just an array of bytes
        Returns:
        An array of bytes with the same value in little endian

      • bigToLittleEndian

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        A test driver for this class. Generates white noise for 1 second in 16 bits.
        Parameters:
        args -
